The mother who shared a heartwarming first dance with her severely disabled son has revealed he nearly died while she was on her honeymoon. 
Jo Atrill was able to take to the dance floor with son Alex Dieterle, who has severe cerebral palsy, after husband Martin secretly made a special harness. 
The moving moment has gone viral and the original video, which shows the family dancing to Coldplay's Yellow, has been viewed over a million times. 
13-year-old Alex stopped breathing for 40 minutes while the couple were on their honeymoon and needed to be resuscitated. Read More Alex was able to dance with mum Jo at her wedding Alex nearly died while Jo was on honeymoon 
Speaking about nearly losing him, Jo said: "We were really lucky our friends and family are very supportive and thought we needed a break and paid for us to go on honeymoon which is incredible. 
But he was on high dependency and needed to be resuscitated whilst we were away. He stopped breathing so he was bad for 40 minutes." 
Jo spent nine months in hospital with Alex as a single mum after he was born before meeting husband Martin, who fell in love with both of them. Read More Rio Ferdinand shares picture with his children as they enjoy Paris break following emotional documentary Martin secretly created the special harness himself 
Martin learnt to sew and secretly created the special harness when Jo went to bed, resulting in an amazing reveal on the big day. 
He said: "We had practised a few timeas. I didn’t think I was going to do it. I couldn’t hold his weight for too long. 
"I don't know how I got through it on the wedding day, it was the pressure of doing it in front of a crowd." Martin appeared on the dance floor with Alex (Photo: PA) 
Jo described the heartwarming moment she was able to dance with her son, who loved host Ruth Langsford's orange top because it's his favourite colour. 
"It was very much like nobody else was in the room. It was just incredilbe. 
"He was staring into my eyes the whole time, it was just magic, the best moment I've ever experienced." Jo and her son shared a heartwarming moment (Photo: PA) 
Viewers broke down with tears at home as they took to Twitter to praise the amazing family. 
One viewer said: "#thismorning this is beautiful but making me cry such a lovely family" 
Another added: "#ThisMorning what an amazing family! Crying my eyes out! Perfect wedding day for them!"
